title: Ticket #6209: Job router retains stale copy of x509UserProxyExpiration
description: Fermilab and Wisconsin are seeing an issue with jobs getting held due to an expired proxy even though the proxy does not appear to be expired when querying the schedd or the proxy directly (https://ticket.grid.iu.edu/33110). It turns out that the copy of the job's x509UserProxyExpiration in the job router is not being updated and since the job router owns the job, it evaluates the SYSTEM_PERIOD_HOLD, and puts the job on hold.
remarks:
2017-Apr-05 15:46:41 by danb:
A workaround is to restart (i.e. kill) condor_job_router once per day.

2017-Apr-14 10:30:58 by jfrey:
We can use the same fix as we do for TimerRemove in #5470. That is, have the job router copy the value of x509UserProxyExpiration from the mirror job log ad of the source job to the ad in RoutedJob just before doing job policy evaluation.

2017-Apr-14 11:16:12 by tlmiller:

Looks good to me.
